item.description:
Meetings

Pre

Intro (20/01/2022)

  • Links

    • Video
    • Slides

  • Objectives

    • Communicate group’s pedagogy, Including motivation, goals, and activities.

Week 0

First Meeting (05/02/2022)

  • Links

    • Audio

  • Objectives

    • Networking, Where Members introduce themselves (15 min)
    • Discussion, On students' collaboration and online communities; Their challenges and suggested solutions (20 min)
    • Discussion, On members' skills and goals, and how to leverage that for projects and subsidy learning (10 min)
    • Gaming, Multiplayer among members (5 min)

  • Summary

    • members introduce themselves

      • lucas: Brazil; Master student in computational biology; Had an unfinished grad course in algorithms; Aims for advanced topics in algorithms.
      • protechthor: Cameron; Math+CS Undergrad; Aims for competitive programming and technical interviews.
      • salvaCasta: Argentina; Undergrad special degree of Engineering and CS with equivalent to a master. took a first course in algorithms. wishes to prepare for hard courses. self-studies measure theory. likes information theory and prepares for it by analysis
      • tilde: Sweden; Undergrad special degree of CS and Engineering equivalent to a Master; Interested in Machine Learning; Has solid background in Algorithms and Data structures. Aims for proofs lens of algorithms; Collaborated with mechatronics and political sciences students
      • ashok: Fresh highschool alumni; Familiar with programming and done machine learning projects; Lacks advanced math and foundational algorithms.

    • mostafa pointed to curious intersections between computer science and information/communication.

    • protechthor expressed struggling with measure theory, as there’s no clear motivation for it; it is too way abstract. mostafa offered help through mathematical logic for appreciating rigorous approaches.

    • mostafa addressed that members might consider practical programming side of algorithms, besides course’s main goal of proofs.

    • ashok explained how Physics might contribute to computing, as processing power is physically realized through the laws of physics.

    • Members talked about the first picture of a blackhole (see this)

  • Quotes

    • salvaCasta: I love it, definitely love it. i do not study math at university. so I just buy a book and try to do every exercise.
    • salvaCasta: Some proofs are just very hard to come up with, but not in technical terms, but rather in creative terms.
    • mostafa: I am sure you will learn alot from this community, ashok .. let me stress the benefit is mutual. I am going to learn from ashok.
    • mostafa: Eventhough ashok is a fresh high school alumini, He was able to actively participate in our discussion.
    • tilde: A course where most of the students participated in the meeting. The teacher created an environment where you felt comfortable to ask questions, even if they felt stupid. He never disregarded those questions. He also started every lecture with a very basic down to earth explanation.

Publications
